actions.args: {"id": 94, "body": {"name": "Funding for Race of Sloths [May-June 2024]", "summary": "\\\\\\\"Race Of Sloths\\\\\\\" is conceived as an innovative platform designed to enhance the open-source software development experience by incorporating elements of gamification directly into the GitHub workflow. This project seeks to not only encourage more frequent and higher quality contributions to open-source repositories but also to foster a community-driven environment where both new and seasoned developers can gain recognition and motivation from their peers.", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "Race of Sloths is a friendly competition where you can participate in challenges and compete with other open-source contributors within your normal workflow\\\\n\\\\nFor contributors:\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Tag the bot inside your pull requests\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Wait for the maintainer to review and score your pull request\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Check out position in the leaderboard on the landing page\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Keep weekly and monthly streaks to reach higher positions\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Boast your contributions with a dynamic picture of your Profile\\\\n\\\\nFor maintainers:\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Score pull requests that participate in the Race of Sloths\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Engage contributors with fair scoring and fast responses so they keep their streaks\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Promote the Race to the point where the Race starts promoting you\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Grow the community of your contributors\\\\n\\\\nDeliverables:\\\\n@race-of-sloths bot on GitHub that is capable to include pull requests in the race and record the scores provided by the maintainers. **We use NEAR for the backend implementation and will use on-chain rewards going forward, and as such onboard real open source developers to NEAR.**\\\\n\\\\nRace of Sloths website that has the following functionality:\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Landing page\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Leaderboards (global and monthly)\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Profile page\\\\n\\\\u{2022} List of participating projects and submission form\\\\n\\\\nlink to GitHub project: https://github.com/orgs/NEAR-DevHub/projects/6\\\\nlink to GitHub repository: https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/race-of-sloths\\\\n\\\\nPlan:\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Launch the MVP of the product in a timeframe of Jul 1st - Jul 15th\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Analyse metrics and measure impact on engaging existing contributors and attracting new ones\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Create a proposal for future product improvement\\\\n\\\\nTeam composition:\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Alex Botezatu - ops lead - ex. NDC, Aurora, Bitfury\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Gleb Palienko - product/project manager - ex. Calimero, Boosty labs, Bitfury\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Artur-Yurii Korchynskyi - tech lead - ex. NDC, GGXchain\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Volodymyr Chabak - designer - ex. LightningPeach\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Andrii Saichuk - frontend developer - ex. NDC\\\\n\\\\nBudget for 2 months: $45.000", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "24a2788251373b64d58200665f12b00cfb2d6c9d2dc79b209d39cd0e433f5b3f", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "45000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

{"id": 94, "body": {"name": "Funding for Race of Sloths [May-June 2024]", "summary": "\\\\\\\"Race Of Sloths\\\\\\\" is conceived as an innovative platform designed to enhance the open-source software development experience by incorporating elements of gamification directly into the GitHub workflow. This project seeks to not only encourage more frequent and higher quality contributions to open-source repositories but also to foster a community-driven environment where both new and seasoned developers can gain recognition and motivation from their peers.", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "Race of Sloths is a friendly competition where you can participate in challenges and compete with other open-source contributors within your normal workflow\\\\n\\\\nFor contributors:\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Tag the bot inside your pull requests\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Wait for the maintainer to review and score your pull request\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Check out position in the leaderboard on the landing page\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Keep weekly and monthly streaks to reach higher positions\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Boast your contributions with a dynamic picture of your Profile\\\\n\\\\nFor maintainers:\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Score pull requests that participate in the Race of Sloths\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Engage contributors with fair scoring and fast responses so they keep their streaks\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Promote the Race to the point where the Race starts promoting you\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Grow the community of your contributors\\\\n\\\\nDeliverables:\\\\n@race-of-sloths bot on GitHub that is capable to include pull requests in the race and record the scores provided by the maintainers. **We use NEAR for the backend implementation and will use on-chain rewards going forward, and as such onboard real open source developers to NEAR.**\\\\n\\\\nRace of Sloths website that has the following functionality:\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Landing page\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Leaderboards (global and monthly)\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Profile page\\\\n\\\\u{2022} List of participating projects and submission form\\\\n\\\\nlink to GitHub project: https://github.com/orgs/NEAR-DevHub/projects/6\\\\nlink to GitHub repository: https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/race-of-sloths\\\\n\\\\nPlan:\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Launch the MVP of the product in a timeframe of Jul 1st - Jul 15th\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Analyse metrics and measure impact on engaging existing contributors and attracting new ones\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Create a proposal for future product improvement\\\\n\\\\nTeam composition:\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Alex Botezatu - ops lead - ex. NDC, Aurora, Bitfury\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Gleb Palienko - product/project manager - ex. Calimero, Boosty labs, Bitfury\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Artur-Yurii Korchynskyi - tech lead - ex. NDC, GGXchain\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Volodymyr Chabak - designer - ex. LightningPeach\\\\n\\\\u{2022} Andrii Saichuk - frontend developer - ex. NDC\\\\n\\\\nBudget for 2 months: $45.000", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "24a2788251373b64d58200665f12b00cfb2d6c9d2dc79b209d39cd0e433f5b3f", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "45000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

{"body": {"name": "Developer Fellowship Contributor Report for 2024-05-06 \\\\u{2013} 2024-05-19", "summary": "Solution: I am submitting this contributor report as a fellowship contributor led by Guillermo (@gagdiez.near).", "category": "Decentralized DevRel", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "gagdiez.near", "description": "Link to the [fellowship program](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Post?id=3011).\\\\n\\\\nSummary of Work\\\\n\\\\n- Meetings/reports/etc: 3h\\\\n- [Fix u/U/NearToken types (FT tutorial)](https://github.com/near-examples/ft-tutorial/pull/2): 2h\\\\n- [Fix u/U/NearToken types (NFT tutorial)](https://github.com/near-examples/nft-tutorial/pull/66): 2h\\\\n- [Near CLI (fix command suggestion)](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs/pull/345): 11h\\\\n\\\\nTotal hours: 18\\\\nHourly rate: $50/hour\\\\nTotal amount: 900$", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "cryptogarik.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "900", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

{"proposal": {"id": 95, "snapshot": {"name": "Developer Fellowship Contributor Report for 2024-05-06 \\\\u{2013} 2024-05-19", "labels": [], "summary": "Solution: I am submitting this contributor report as a fellowship contributor led by Guillermo (@gagdiez.near).", "category": "Decentralized DevRel", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "editor_id": "cryptogarik.near", "timestamp": "1717074855050886552", "supervisor": "gagdiez.near", "description": "Link to the [fellowship program](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Post?id=3011).\\\\n\\\\nSummary of Work\\\\n\\\\n- Meetings/reports/etc: 3h\\\\n- [Fix u/U/NearToken types (FT tutorial)](https://github.com/near-examples/ft-tutorial/pull/2): 2h\\\\n- [Fix u/U/NearToken types (NFT tutorial)](https://github.com/near-examples/nft-tutorial/pull/66): 2h\\\\n- [Near CLI (fix command suggestion)](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs/pull/345): 11h\\\\n\\\\nTotal hours: 18\\\\nHourly rate: $50/hour\\\\nTotal amount: 900$", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "cryptogarik.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "900", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "cryptogarik.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "DevHub Developer Contributor report by Vadim for 2024-06-05 - 2024-31-05", "summary": "Made fixes for RFP feature, updated devhub indexer to use context-db methods, created environments to deploy on different accounts; Created PR for standardizing errors in near-sdk-rs.", "category": "DevDAO Platform", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "I am submitting this contributor report as a contributor led by @frol.near\\\\nThis is my 5th contributor report. You can find my previous report [here](https://dev.near.org/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=71)\\\\n\\\\n# Project Details and Timeline\\\\nMade fixes for RFP feature, updated devhub indexer to use context-db methods, created environments to deploy on different accounts; Created PR for standardizing errors in near-sdk-rs.\\\\n\\\\n## Week 1, May 6 - May 12\\\\n[8h] - Monday - made example project correct and added tests, added method for calling error in separate promise, modified caller so that it calls correctly (including extern C function, ext contract method implementation, and calling it, and state_write) so that tests work in that case. Added linked_rfp to the proposals\\\\\\' indexer [PR #3 indexer](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-proposals-indexer/pull/3).\\\\n[8h] - Tuesday - fixed handle_result and tests for it, did panic with json, used attribute macro instead of derive to automate derives for json serialization, removed check_trait from imports in examples, supported struct errors and added test for it, changed methods creation to use near macro instead of manual creation, passed error message when creating promise.\\\\n[1.5h] - Wednesday - meeting + fix set_global_labels\\\\n[8.5h] - Thursday - added linked proposals to contract and the indexer, call with Megha\\\\n[6h] - Friday - added filter to get_proposals, added accepted_terms_and_conditions_version argument to add_proposal, added cancel_rfp method, fixed coderabbit review for rfp for contract and indexer, found out a range of commits where the problem with deserializing post 606 occurred\\\\n[3h] - Saturday - fixed post 606 [PR #113](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/pull/113)\\\\n\\\\n8 + 8 + 1.5 + 8.5 + 6 + 3 = 35\\\\n\\\\n## Week 2, May 13 - May 19\\\\n[8h] - Monday - fixed bug in labels setting when editing proposal linked to rfp, for standartized error: generate method only if it has persist_on_error instead of always, add typename to serde output, learn more about lifetimes and trait bounds in rust, research on implementing from ContractError for Box\\\\n[6h] - Tuesday - separate branch for post 606 fix, removed check for cancel, added RFP snapshot history update when linking proposals, add RFP label change to proposal snapshot history to indexer, fixed bug with linked proposals in RFP in indexer, research on test environment for indexers\\\\n[8h] - Wednesday - fixed bugs for RFP indexer, tested and redeployed; started fixing review for RFPs; meeting\\\\n[7h] - Thursday - fixed review for RFPs, replaced snapshot history with block height, added correct abi tokens for standartized errors, started refactoring for standartized errors\\\\n[3h] - Friday - moved terms & conditions to separate pr and fixed, fixed repost message, research on migration to context db, continue refactoring standartized errors\\\\n[3h] - Sunday - added rfp and proposal versions and their body versions to indexer, changed linked_proposals from string to array. Fixed some errors. Figured out that it\\\\\\'s better to use social db block height from contract as it\\\\\\'s difficult to get from indexer\\\\n\\\\n8 + 6 + 8 + 7 + 3 + 3 = 35\\\\n\\\\n## Week 3, May 20 - May 26\\\\n[12h] - Monday - refactored code for standartized errors and fixed tests; wrapped up the question about box dyn contracterror; started work on migrating indexer to context-db methods; discussed indexer with Megha; fixed stringifying timeline, nullable labels, cancel_rfp and snapshot selection in indexer; fixes for final review for devhub contract [PR #110](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/pull/110)\\\\n[7h] - Tuesday - switched indexer to using context-db methods: [PR 2 indexer](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-proposals-indexer/pull/2) and finalized review for RFP, work on review and research on standartizing errors\\\\n[5h] - Wednesday - removed returns and added docs for standartizing errors review, fixed migration test for devhub contract [PR #118](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/pull/118) and added ordering to get_global_labels, redeployed test contract from scratch, weekly devhub meeting\\\\n\\\\n12 + 7 + 5 = 24\\\\n\\\\n## Week 4, May 27 - May 31\\\\n[2.5h] - Monday - made all proposals after approved stage available for selection, set up infrastructure-committee.near account, start work on github actions for RFPs. \\\\n[3.5h] - Tuesday - added environments to actions - [PR #124](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/pull/124)\\\\n[8h] - Wednesday - switched to error structure from NEAR RPC, add baseerror, snapshot for generated method_error, tested environments, merged fixes for ci, deployed new version on infrastructure-committee.near and indexer, had a look on figma for treasury dashboard, started work on error list & using errors in examples, devhub weekly meeting\\\\n[7.5h] - Thursday - Added several error types, added unwrap_or_err and require_or_err macros, updated examples and contract standards to use new errors, fixed bugs\\\\n[9.5h] - Friday - used standard errors features in examples and near-contract-standards, fixed bugs, added docs, refactored, fixed tests, moved [PR #1655 near-sdk-rs](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/pull/1165) from draft to review\\\\n\\\\n2.5 + 3.5 + 8 + 7.5 + 9.5 = 31\\\\n\\\\nOverall: 35 + 35 + 24 + 31 = 125\\\\n# Budget Breakdown\\\\nTotal hours: 125\\\\nRate: $50/hour\\\\nTotal amount: $6250 USDT\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [71], "receiver_account": "polyprogrammist.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "6250", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": []}

{"data": {"devhub.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *DevDAO Platform* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @polyprogrammist.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}DevHub Developer Contributor report by Vadim for 2024-06-05 - 2024-31-05\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nMade fixes for RFP feature, updated devhub indexer to use context-db methods, created environments to deploy on different accounts; Created PR for standardizing errors in near-sdk-rs.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=96)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

Fixed some errors. {"data": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"image\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"ipfs_cid\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"bafkreigqg2flmnslppqsrkfbg2wh4mqg34dq7cnebmxntdva37g4bqqoam\\\\\\\"},\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Join us for the **2nd Chain Abstraction Community Call** on Friday the *7th of June, at 4 PM UTC* \\\\u{1f60e}\\\\u{1f389} \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nTopics include:\\\\\\\\n- Super Omnichain Account Platform presentation  \\\\\\\\n- Chainsig library call for contributors \\\\\\\\n- Near <> ETH Tunnel demo\\\\\\\\n- Asset storage standards and keeping track discussion\\\\\\\\n- Verifying the state of other chains discussion\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{1f5d3} [Add to your calendar](https://bit.ly/chainabstraction2) \\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}, "handle": "chain-abstraction"}

{"body": {"name": "DevRel Contributor Report | 20 - 31 May", "summary": "Bi-weekly paid developer relations contributor report. The aim of these activities is to onboard more developers to the ecosystem, and assist existing developers with problems or enrich their experience in the ecosystem. Activities for the last two weeks can be seen below.", "category": "Decentralized DevRel", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "**Tooling Contribution (10 hours)**\\\\n* https://github.com/frol/bos-component-ts-starter\\\\n* https://github.com/shelegdmitriy/near-social-vm-types\\\\n\\\\n**Community Support (3h)**\\\\n* Responding to questions on StackOverflow and Telegram\\\\n* Livestream preparation\\\\n* 1-1 Mentorship Meetings\\\\n\\\\n**Marketing & Retention (8h)**\\\\n* Collecting a list of obstacles that new developers experience on Near and which eventually make them leave the ecosystem\\\\n* Writing up a plan with activities that are designed to improve the retention of developers in the ecosystem\\\\n\\\\n**Other (2 hours)**\\\\n* Internal Meetings - weekly stand-up, 1-on-1 with team members\\\\n\\\\n**Timeline**\\\\nStart Date: 5/20/2024\\\\nEnd Date: 5/31/2024\\\\n\\\\n**Requested Funding**\\\\nTotal hours: 23\\\\nRate: $50/hour\\\\nTotal amount: $1150 USD", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "denbite.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1150", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "OTHER"}, "labels": []}
